Name: Art Library
News: Catch up with the latest news on our Facebook page
Details: Enjoy life from a new perspective. Find out what's happening in the world of art and design - from cave paintings to the Turner Prize, from early pottery to the latest trends in architecture, fashion and photography, the Art Library is here to meet all your needs in the visual arts.
Opening hours: Mon, Tue, Wed: 10am - 8pm. Thu, Fri, Sat: 10am-5pm
Facilities: Self service
Libraries home page: <a href="http://www.edinburgh.gov.uk/libraries" rel="nofollow">Find out all about libraries including borrowing, reserving and renewing books

Name: Central Children's Library
News: Catch up with the latest news on our Facebook page including details of our summer events programme for children
Details: Explore a wide choice of stories, old and new, together with lots of picture books for younger readers. Not forgetting our DVDs.  We also have excellent books to help with school projects and hobbies. Join in with our storytimes and rhymetimes, and keep an eye out for our other children’s events held throughout the year.

Name: Central Lending Library
News: Catch up with the latest news on our Facebook page
Details: High interest rates guaranteed with a great and varied collection of all the latest titles plus old favourites.    Choose from a wide range of fact and fiction including collections of travel books, language courses, maps and DVDs. Our friendly staff are always on hand to help and advise you with selection.   Don't forget to look out for our topical displays and themed events.

Facilities: Self service
Book groups: First Thursday of every month at 6pm. Please contact gail.mcinally@edinburgh.gov.uk (tel 0131 242 8060) for more details.

Please note: The Edinburgh and Scottish Collection is currently closed for refurbishment. The rest of Central Library is open as normal.

Name: Mobile Libraries
News: Find your nearest mobile library stop
Details:
The mobile library service offers a window to the full range of library services. You can join on board and choose from a wide range of books for children and adults. There are over 2,000 books and talking books to choose from - or request any of our 500,000 loan items for free and collect them on your next visit.
All of our mobile library buses are fully accessible and wheelchair friendly.

Name: Morningside Library
News: Get the latest news on our Facebook page
Details:
Morningside Library has been closed since 8 December 2012 due to dry rot. It has been essential to close the building to allow us to investigate the problems and appoint a contractor to carry out the repair work. 
While the library is closed we're working hard to serve our community in alternative locations. We've got the library mobile parked on Falcon Road West where you can borrow and return books, and keep in touch with our staff team. Its opening hours are Monday 10am-7pm, Tuesday to Saturday 10am-4pm.
Our monthly bookgroups on Monday nights and Thursday afternoons are running from Newington Library, along with our fortnightly sewing group on Monday evenings which is still open for new members.
Our much needed library link and housebound service are also running from Newington Library, meaning that Morningside Library members with mobility issues can continue to access our services or have books, dvds and cds delivered to their homes.
Our staff team is gearing up for summer by visiting schools in the area to promote our reading challenge, and will soon be advertising summer activities in local church halls to ensure local children don't miss out.
Our Bookbug Sessions are currently being held in the Eric Liddell Centre at 10.30am every Tuesday morning.
Whilst the building is closed we are taking the opportunity to plan an even better library when we reopen. Your ideas and suggestions for any improvements we could deliver in time for the reopening are welcome, as well as any suggestions for service delivery while we're closed, so please get in touch at southteam@edinburgh.gov.uk and we can add your details to our mailing list.
Libraries home page: <a href="http://www.edinburgh.gov.uk/libraries" rel="nofollow">Find out all about libraries including borrowing, reserving and renewing books

Name: Reference Library
News: Catch up with the latest news on our Facebook page
Details: A collection of a third of a million items,  helpful staff, free internet access and the beautiful surroundings of the reading room make the reference library the ideal place for information, research, study or just relaxing in peaceful contemplation. Contact us with your enquiry or visit us to browse the collection and use our study facilities - including free wi-fi.
Opening hours: Mon, Tue, Wed: 10am-8pm. Thu, Fri, Sat: 10am-5pm
Libraries home page: <a href="http://www.edinburgh.gov.uk/libraries" rel="nofollow">Find out all about libraries including borrowing, reserving and renewing books

Name: Resource Centre
Details: The Resource Centre offers access to screen magnification and speech output software. We have a variety of equipment which will read aloud documents and books, and a CCTV magnifier which can enlarge pictures and text, as well as a range of mice and keyboards. If you want to guarantee the use of special equipment or one-to-one staff support, we recommend you book in advance by phone or call in to the library.
Opening hours: Mon - Fri: 10am-1pm and 2pm-5pm
Book groups: The VIP book group meets on the third Thursday of the month from 10.30am - noon. Contact us for details

Free song, story and rhyme sessions for 0-4 year olds and their parents and carers. 
First and third Tuesday of the month, 10.30 - 11.15am

Other events:
Learn IT computer classes - ask at library for details
Knitting Bee - share knitting and crochet hints and tips over a coffee. join us anytime! We meet on the last Monday of the month at 6.30pm
Baby and toddler cafe 2nd and 4th Tuesday each month 10.30-11.30am. Drop in space to relax and chat with others parents over a coffee. Children's toys, books, magazines, with occasional activities and demonstrations
Get in touch if you would like to bring a nursery or toddler group to the library for a Cuddly Bear Storytime visit (or we can visit you!)
Business Workshops: Stockbridge Library is a Business Hub which provides support and advice for starting or growing your business. Professional workshops are run by the Business Gateway at the Hub and you can also access a fantastic range of databases and up-to-date business books. Check the Business Gateway site for details of workshops taking place in the library
